com.sdicons.json.validator

Class ValidatorBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sdicons.json.validator.ValidatorBuilder

  • public class ValidatorBuilder
extends Object
    A builder class to create atomic and composite JSON validators. The validators can be constructed manually but it is a much easier job using this builder. 
     
 Validator v = vb.range(50, 100);
 p = new JSONParser("55");
 json = p.nextValue();
 v.validate(json);

      • range

        public Validator range(Integer min,
              Integer max)
        An anonymous Range validator.
        Parameters:
        min - The lower bound (inclusive). Value null means that there is no lower boundary.
        max - The upper bound (inclusive). Value null means that there is no upper boundary.
        Returns:
        The range validator.

        Parameters:

        min - The lower boundary (inclusive). Value null means that there is no lower boundary.
        max - The upper bound (inclusive). Value null means that there is no upper boundary.
        Returns:
        The named validator.

      • and

        public Validator and(String ruleName,
            Validator... validators)
        Create a named and-combination Andof a series of validators. The validation process halts when the first failure is encountered.
        Parameters:
        ruleName - The name of the rule under construction.
        validators - The array of validators that will be combined using the and operator.
        Returns:
        The requested validator.

      • and

        public Validator and(Validator... validators)
        Create an anonymous and-combination And of a series of validators. The validation process halts when the first failure is encountered.
        Parameters:
        validators - The array of validators that will be combined using the and operator.
        Returns:
        The requested validator.

      • ref

        public Validator ref(String ruleName,
            String ref)
        Create a named Ref validator. It creates an alias for another named rule. It is useful to refer to another rule inside a composite validator.
        Parameters:
        ruleName - The name of the validator under construction.
        ref - The name of the rule you are referring to.
        Returns:
        The new validator.

        Returns:

      • enumeration

        public Validator enumeration(String ruleName,
                    String... values)
        A convenience method to create a named Enumeration validation using a set of String values. The elements of the enumeration are JSONValue instances, but this method lets you construct the enumeration using plain Strings.
        Parameters:
        ruleName - The name of the validation rule.
        values - The elements of the enumeration set, they will be converted to JSONString values.
        Returns:
        The enumeration validation rule.

      • enumeration

        public Validator enumeration(String... values)
        A convenience method to create a named Enumeration validation using a set of String values. The elements of the enumeration are JSONValue instances, but this method lets you construct the enumeration using plain Strings.
        Parameters:
        values - The String values of the enumeration, they will be converted to JSONStrings.
        Returns:
        The enumeration validation rule.

      • or

        public Validator or(String ruleName,
           Validator... validators)
        Create a named composite Or validation. The value must match against one of the inner rules.
        Parameters:
        ruleName - The name for our rule.
        validators - The inner validators, one of it must succeed on the value for the complete matcher to succeed.
        Returns:
        The new validator.

      • or

        Create an anonymous Or validation rule. The value must match against one of the inner rules.
        Parameters:
        validators - The inner validators, one of it must succeed on the value for the complete matcher to succeed.
        Returns:
        The new validator.

      • properties

        public Validator properties(String ruleName,
                   Properties.PropRule... rules)
        Create a named Properties validator to check the key/value pairs of an object.
        Parameters:
        ruleName - The name of the validator.
        rules - An array of Properties.PropRule, each rule can validate a specific property of the object. You can use the propRule(String, Validator, boolean) method to quickly create the property rules.
        Returns:
        The new validator.

      • properties

        public Validator properties(Properties.PropRule... rules)
        Create an anonymous Properties validator to check the key/value pairs of an object.
        Parameters:
        rules - An array of Properties.PropRule, each rule can validate a specific property of the object. You can use the propRule(String, Validator, boolean) method to quickly create the property rules.
        Returns:
        The new validator.

      • switchrule

        public Validator switchrule(String ruleName,
                   String discriminator,
                   Switch.SwitchCase... cases)
        Create a named Switch validator.
        Parameters:
        ruleName - The name of the rule.
        discriminator - The name of the field that will be used to select a Switch.SwitchCase.
        cases - An array of Switch.SwitchCase elements. You can use the switchcase(Validator, JSONValue...) method to quickly create a case.
        Returns:
        The new validator.

      • switchrule

        public Validator switchrule(String discriminator,
                   Switch.SwitchCase... cases)
        Create an anonymous Switch validator.
        Parameters:
        discriminator - The name of the field that will be used to select a Switch.SwitchCase.
        cases - An array of Switch.SwitchCase elements. You can use the switchcase(Validator, JSONValue...) method to quickly create a case.
        Returns:
        The new validator.

      • switchcase

        public static Switch.SwitchCase switchcase(Validator rule,
                           JSONValue... values)
        Create a Switch.SwitchCase that can be used to build a Switch validator.
        Parameters:
        rule - The internal validator.
        values - The discriminating values. If the discriminator is one of these values, the rule will be applied to the complete object.
        Returns:
        The SwitchCase.

      • propRule

        public static Properties.PropRule propRule(String propName,
                           Validator rule,
                           boolean optional)
        Create a Properties.PropRule that is used to build a Properties validator for objects.
        Parameters:
        propName - The name of the object property to which this rule applies.
        rule - The validator for this property.
        optional - A flag to indicate if the property is optional or not. If it is not optional, a validation error will occur if the object does not have a property with that name.
        Returns:
        The property rule.
